meanings.definition: A type of medieval body armor consisting of small metal plates sewn into a fabric garment.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore a brigandine to protect himself in battle.
meanings.sent2: The brigandine was heavy but provided excellent protection.
meanings.sent3: The brigandine looked like a shiny puzzle piece when worn.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a brigandine shielding her from criticism.
meanings.sent5: The brigandine gleamed under the sunlight, a symbol of strength and resilience.

meanings.definition: To equip or arm with a brigandine.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith would brigandine the soldiers before the upcoming war.
meanings.sent2: She decided to brigandine herself with the best armor available.
meanings.sent3: The idea to brigandine the town with protective gear was met with relief.
meanings.sent4: He brigandined his mind with knowledge to face the challenges ahead.
meanings.sent5: The team brigandined themselves with confidence before the big game.
